structural_necessity.logic: 8-10 if must exist (structural gap), 5-7 if should exist (efficiency gain), 2-4 if nice to have

force_alignment.logic: Count forces >= 5, weight by velocity: accelerating=1.5x, steady=1.0x, decelerating=0.5x

timing_grade.logic: 8-10 if optimal window NOW, 5-7 if 2-3 years, crash resilience adds 1-2

structural_necessity.rationale: Must exist. CPA pipeline -33% and SMB formation at 532K/month create structural supply-demand gap that only AI can close. $207B Baumol stored energy releasing. No alternative path exists.

force_alignment.rationale: 3 forces >= 5 (F1=9 accelerating 1.5x=13.5, F2=8 steady 1.0x=8, F4=7 shifting 1.0x=7). All three forces are strong and aligned. Weighted sum 28.5/30 = 9.5, capped at 9.

geographic_grade.rationale: US=9, China=4, EU=6, Japan=5, India=7, LATAM=5, SEA=4, MENA=4. Average = 5.5. Primarily US opportunity with India secondary.

timing_grade.rationale: Optimal entry window 2026-2027 is NOW. Time sensitivity high. Crash resilience high (accounting is mandatory). Base 9 + crash resilience 1 = 10.

capital_efficiency.rationale: $500K-$3M capital, 3 months to revenue, 85% gross margin. Lower end is under $1M with <12mo profitability. Strong capital efficiency.

timing_grade.rationale: Optimal window 2026-2028 is NOW. PE distress rate at 11.98%. Time sensitivity high. Counter-cyclical = crash resilience high. Base 9 + crash 1 = 10.

rated_models.model_name: AI Financial Compliance and Governance Platform

structural_necessity.rationale: Must exist. 87% of financial institutions using AI need compliance infrastructure. AI governance market growing 51x ($309M to $15.8B). EU AI Act mandates compliance. Regulatory requirement = structural necessity.

timing_grade.rationale: Optimal entry 2026-2027 is NOW. EU AI Act enforcement approaching. Crash resilience high (compliance is mandatory, scandal increases demand). Base 9 + crash 1 = 10.

capital_efficiency.rationale: $2M-$10M capital, 6 months to revenue, 80% margin. Mid-range at $2-10M, strong margins. 5-7 range.

rankings_by_composite.model_name: AI Financial Compliance and Governance Platform

analysis_notes.structural_winners_dominate: 7 of 15 models qualify as STRUCTURAL_WINNER (SN>=8 AND FA>=8). This reflects the current moment: multiple structural forces converging across sectors create businesses that MUST exist. The engine is identifying genuine structural gaps, not marginal opportunities.
analysis_notes.no_parked_models: All 15 models score above 60 composite. This is expected because Agent B only constructed models with strong structural foundations. Lower-quality opportunities were filtered at the signal grading stage.
analysis_notes.capital_efficiency_separates_tiers: The top 3 models (MC-52-001, MC-54-001, MC-62-001 platforms) all have CE >= 7. The acquisition models (MC-52-002, MC-56-002, MC-31-003) score 3-4 on CE, depressing their composites despite strong structural scores. This correctly reflects the higher execution risk of capital-intensive acquisition strategies.
analysis_notes.geographic_concentration_risk: Most models are US-concentrated (average GG 5.0). India-US arbitrage (MC-54-003) and Rural Telehealth (MC-62-003) are notable exceptions with broader geographic applicability. The GEOGRAPHIC_PLAY category highlights models where geographic arbitrage is the primary value driver.
analysis_notes.timing_arbitrage_is_real: MC-52-002 and MC-56-002 (distressed acquirers) score 10 on timing. The PE refinancing wall creates a 2-3 year window that is genuinely time-bound. These models score lower overall due to capital requirements but represent real timing arbitrage opportunities.
analysis_notes.fear_economy_validated: MC-52-003 (AI Financial Compliance) validates the FEAR_ECONOMY category. Psychology drives demand for this product, not inhibits it. The $86B fear economy by 2030 is a structural market creation from F5 Psychology.
